newsitem.title: USA: American Dental cuts costs, posts profit.
newsitem.headline: American Dental cuts costs, posts profit.

text.p: American Dental Technologies Inc said on Tuesday that its profitable third quarter was largely a result of cost cutting.
Earlier, American Dental reported a profit of $0.02 a share for the third quarter on revenues of $4.05 million versus a loss of $0.06 last year on revenues of $2.29 million.

"Profits increased primarily due to cost sharing with Texas Airsonics Inc before the merger and the company's continuing efforts to reduce selling and general expenses in relation to revenues," Ben Gallant, president and chief operating officer, said in a statement.

In addition, the company said sales of its KCP air abrasive dental treatment systems rose, increasing revenues. The KCP works like a miniature sandblaster spraying away decay, usually without the need for anesthesia.
Last July, American Dental acquired Texas Airsonics, which also developed and manufactured air abrasive products.
